net.java.jddac.jmdi.fblock
Class Reporter

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.fblock.Entity
      net.java.jddac.jmdi.fblock.FunctionBlock
          net.java.jddac.jmdi.fblock.Reporter
All Implemented Interfaces:
ConfigurationInterface, Status.Report, MessageHandler, CommListener, SubscriberCallback
public class Reporter
extends FunctionBlock
implements MessageHandler, CommListener, Status.Report

Queues messages. Connects to a remote endpoint at a preset interval (or 'on demand') and sends messages to the remote endpoint.

The reporter will accumulate messages until one of the following occurs:

  • Reporter.maxMessageGroup messages have been accumulated.
  • The time since the last connection exceeds the Reporter.connectInterval setting.
  • The Reporter has been configured with Reporter.reportOnDemand as true and a message is received.
When the reporter establishes a connection it sends messages in groups defined by the Reporter.groupSize argument. The Reporter.groupSize argument can be set to smaller or larger values depending on the type of network connection, costs, or other factors.

Method Detail

configure

public void configure(ArgArray configuration)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Description copied from interface: ConfigurationInterface
Provides a method to configure object properties. The registry argument contains an ArgArray composed named values. Any values that are not specified are assumed to be left unchanged. That is, if a value is not present, do not assume it means 0 or true or some other default. This allows the configure method to be used to set a single value without affecting other values.

Specified by:
configure in interface ConfigurationInterface
Overrides:
configure in class FunctionBlock
Parameters:
configuration - contains incoming configuration parameters as named values.

Name Default Description
Reporter.timeout 0 (none) Maximum time a connection is allowed to take before it is considered permanently 'hung'. The (@link getStatus) method will return 'Err IO Hang' in this case.
Reporter.errorBackoff 5 minutes Amount of time to wait after getting a transport error.
Reporter.destination   A URL indicating the connection endpoint for reporter communications. e.g. http://jddac.labs.agilent.com/server/probe
Reporter.connectInterval 3600 An interval in seconds which specifies how often the reporter will send messages in it's queue. A value of zero effectively turns off periodic connections.
Reporter.transport   A string indicating the object name of an object that implements the TransportInterface api. e.g. 'transport'. This object should be registered with the global NCAP instance.
Reporter.reportOnDemand false A Boolean true or false. When true, the reporter will immediately report any publications as soon as they arrive instead of queueing them for later transmission.
Reporter.maxMessageQueue 20 The maximum number of messages that will be queued for later transmission.
Reporter.queueFullSize 10 When the message queue reaches this number, an attempt will be made to transmit the messages to the server.
Reporter.maxMessageGroup 10 The maximum number of messages that are bundled into one communications session. Some environments have constrained memory which may limit the overall size of any individual communication. This parameter allows this to be 'tuned' for these environments.
Reporter.commSubList   Specifies non-local communication traffic patterns. See CommFabric.addMessageListener(Vector, CommListener) for details.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
See Also:
ConfigurationInterface.configure(net.java.jddac.common.type.ArgArray)

notifySubscriber

public void notifySubscriber(short subscriber_id,
                             java.lang.String publicationTopic,
                             ArgArray inArgs)
                      throws OpException
Description copied from class: FunctionBlock
required method for SubscriberCallback. This method is provided so that sub-classes do not need to do anything if they want to ignore publications. Typically, a class which inherits from FunctionBlock will override this method with its own.

Specified by:
notifySubscriber in interface SubscriberCallback
Overrides:
notifySubscriber in class FunctionBlock
Parameters:
subscriber_id - The ID which was passed into the SubscriberPort when subscribing to topic
publicationTopic - The topic that the publication was published on.
inArgs - The payload which was published.
Throws:
OpException
